article:
'The World Medical Association' (WMA) is an international and independent
confederation of free professional Medical Associations, therefore representing
physicians worldwide. WMA was formally established on September 18,
1947 [http://www.wma.net/en/60about/70history/index.html WMA - History ] and had grown in 2011 to 97 National Medical Ass-
ociations [http://www.wma.net/en/60about/10members/20memberlist/index.html
WMA - List of Members ] and more than 10
million physicians.

The WMA provides a forum for its member associations to communicate freely, to
co-operate actively, to achieve consensus on high standards of medical ethics
and professional competence and to promote the professional freedom of
physicians worldwide.
